intro: Andryala ragusina var. minor, commonly known as the Sicilian dwarf bellflower, is a rare and endemic plant native to the island of Sicily. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
